data.q: What does the 'Largest Contentful Paint' (LCP) metric measure in Web Vitals?
o: The time it takes for the entire page to finish downloading
The render time of the largest image or text block visible within the viewport
The delay between a user's first interaction and the browser's response
The total number of bytes transferred for the main document
data.e: LCP is a Core Web Vital that measures perceived load speed, marking the point in the page load timeline when the main content has likely loaded.

data.q: Which metric is used to quantify visual stability and prevent 'layout shifts' while a page is loading?
data.e: CLS measures the sum total of all individual layout shift scores for every unexpected layout shift that occurs during the entire lifespan of the page.

o: Breaking a single JavaScript bundle into smaller chunks that can be loaded on demand
Dividing the backend and frontend into different repositories
Writing CSS and HTML in separate files
data.e: Code splitting allows you to 'lazy load' parts of the application only when the user needs them, significantly reducing the initial load time.

data.q: How does the 'Image Lazy Loading' attribute (`loading="lazy"`) improve performance?
o: It delays the loading of images until they are close to the user's viewport
It converts images to the WebP format
It hides images from screen readers
data.e: Lazy loading saves bandwidth and reduces initial page weight by not loading images that the user might never scroll to see.

data.q: What is the primary purpose of a 'Content Delivery Network' (CDN)?
o: To serve static assets from servers physically closer to the user to reduce latency
To provide a domain name for the website
data.e: CDNs store copies of your files (images, JS, CSS) in multiple data centers worldwide, shortening the distance data travels to reach the user.

data.q: Which technique involves rendering the initial HTML on the server instead of the client-side browser?
data.e: SSR provides a faster 'First Contentful Paint' and better SEO because the browser receives a fully-formed HTML document rather than an empty div.

data.q: What does 'Minification' do to CSS and JavaScript files?
o: It converts the code into a different programming language
It removes whitespace, comments, and shortens variable names to reduce file size
It adds comments to explain the code's logic
It encrypts the code to prevent theft
data.e: Minification reduces the number of bytes that need to be sent over the network without changing the functionality of the code.

data.q: In the browser's Rendering Pipeline, which step follows the creation of the 'Render Tree'?
data.e: After the Render Tree is built, the browser performs 'Layout' to calculate the exact geometry (position and size) of each visible element.

data.q: What is the benefit of using the `defer` attribute on a `<script>` tag?
o: It makes the script load synchronously
It executes the script immediately upon download
It allows the HTML to continue parsing while the script downloads, executing only after parsing is complete
It prevents the script from being cached
data.e: Unlike `async`, `defer` ensures that scripts are executed in order and only after the DOM is fully parsed, preventing 'render-blocking' behavior.

data.q: Which HTTP version introduced 'Multiplexing', allowing multiple requests to be sent over a single TCP connection?
data.e: HTTP/2 multiplexing significantly reduces latency by allowing the browser to request many files simultaneously without needing multiple separate connections.

o: Algorithms used to compress text-based assets (HTML, CSS, JS) during transfer
data.e: These compression algorithms reduce the transfer size of your assets. Brotli generally offers better compression ratios than Gzip for web content.

o: Inlining only the CSS required to style the 'above-the-fold' content to speed up initial render
Combining all CSS files into one large file
data.e: By inlining critical CSS, the browser can start rendering the visible part of the page immediately without waiting for an external stylesheet to download.
